title: Tank META is the healthiest META
body: The reason I say this is because tanks have quite a few niches such as mobility and being able to be kited. This offers quite a bit of counter play and not to mention {{item:3071}} {{item:3135}} {{item:3151}} {{item:3035}} exist. Where as Mage/Assassin META was burst your opponents face in then run and repeat. i always wonder why this is called tank meta, just cause tanks are viable, it's not like assasins are usless all of a sudden, or that ADCs aren't the center of every team anymore.
It's just not a meta without tanks anymore, not a meta dominated by tanks, which 'Tank Meta' kinda implies...

Because it is dominated by tanks right now, with Cinderhulk TANKS ( Team. Anti .Nuke .Killer. Survivors. Yeah make no sense, but I tried :/) are really powerful because Cinderhulk scales with % health, this means that for building health you gain a lot extra. This is really powerful as health counters both AD and AP especially early on as no one has very much damage. So now with every tank reaching 2000 Health after 1 health item and Cinderhulk means by mid game they have a lot of health, armour, mr and adequate damage to win teamfights. Also not to mention cinderhulk was a major fucking buff (pardon my french) since it allows Tanks to do what bruisers do and clear camps very quickly. {{champion:111}} {{champion:32}} {{champion:102}} are some tanks to note as OP.

Not only is Shyvana in a terrible state right now, but really, high survivability means nothing when there's no one on your team to do damage. Back in the assassin meta, it was common to see a toplane assassin, a midlane assassin and a jungle assassin. But right now in the "tank meta" you're only seeing a single tank (the jungler), because their role is to defend and set up plays for the actual damage dealers of a team, too much tank and you're peeling and setting a lot of CC for no-one.

What cinderhulk did was make jungle tanking viable, and since tanks have terrible laning phases, the only place they could possibly be is in the jungle anyways. It just turns out that, now that tanks, which offer great support to a team, can possibly exist in the jungle, they become the most valuable jungle asset.

They naturally crowd out the jungle bruiser picks because they offer more utility and teamfight potential, as long as tanks are viable, the meta will favor having at least one. Wait for the tank meta to develop a bit and we'll see a comeback from the tank-busters like Trundle,  Jax and Shyvana, and expect BotRK to be built more often by ADC's. I'd hate for Riot to kneejerk nerf before letting a healthy meta develop.

Just a nitpick, but it's not an acronym.  There's no need to capitalize all the letters.  Meta merely refers to the current state of the game.  It's an additional set of unofficial rules and guidelines to which the majority of players adhere.  Meta- is a prefix, and the full relevant term for LoL would be metagame.  Players are "gaming" the game by figuring out what strategies are most effective within the current constraints.

He might have capitalized it because some people like to make it an acronym of "Most Efficient Tactics Available." 

Carry on, though. I really don't mean to impede you, because I agree.
That's one of the silliest backronyms I've heard since fornication under consent of king.

The acronym is just a gimmick really, meta as a word means the almost same thing, just it isn't restricted to the gaming world. You can have anything from metanarrative (the "great story" or story of the world) to metaphysics (philosophy focused on the fundamental nature of existence) to metagame (the abstract or undefined set of systems in a game that transcend mechanical rules, guidelines, or similar systems).
